### PR summary [856bc6554e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22387/commits/856bc6554e787511f300959f510d621ff25fec45)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ comm_topologicalAddGroup_is_uniform`
`+ uniformGroup_of_commGroup`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (39.00, 0.01)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|3247|-39|porting notes|

Current commit [856bc6554e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/856bc6554e787511f300959f510d621ff25fec45)
Reference commit [ab1d2f2636](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/ab1d2f26368cf02cd79b996f5dcb997d576e96e5)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13598775124/job/38021195806)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13598775124/job/38021195946)
If you split this rename into a separate PR, I'll maintainer merge it right away (i.e., by Monday). :-)
I'm actually okay with this as it's related to addressing a porting note.

These porting notes are picking up on an actual problem. The person porting this didn't mark `ContinuousAffineMap.toAffineMap` with the `@[coe]` attribute (probably in part because this function is declared via the `extends` keyword). So when `norm_cast` looks at this lemma it sees a single coercion on each side of `=` (instead of two on the LHS and one on the RHS). I'll fix this in a another PR, but please undo the deletion of these three notes (the one above synth order can still be removed).

I'm not so sure about this one. The problem is that, to my surprise, `LinearMap.restrictScalars` has the `@[coe]` attribute (but `ContinuousLinearMap.restrictScalars` does not). So again, `norm_cast` is making the correct judgment here, and it's indicating a discrepancy in our handling of `restrictScalars` in the continuous case.

So for right now, would you mind reverting it?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: more porting notes
